bibdata.title: Correction on the isbn_display field

comments.body:
@hackartisan I'm sorry I didn't see the question until earlier today. 
We should not index the isbn_display if 020$a is missing. The isbn_display field is what we see in the catalog record page as ISBN.
For example: https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/99121576653506421/ (hardcover) should not display. In the staff_view https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/99121576653506421/staff_view the 3rd `020 z| 9781138388888 q| hardcover` has no $a.

This is also an issue in production. Would it be better to apply this change in the main branch and we pull it with the rebase?
I updated my previous comment as : ` if 020$a `
üëçüèª we agreed on slack this will be fine to just go in the alma branch

bibdata.title: Alma implementation for availability#index
Redesign location data pipeline

comments.body:
We held some meetings, with notes recorded in the document linked above.

The decision was to move away from a database and to a json file in the repository that holds all the location data.

Any time a change is needed to the location data (labels, flags, mappings), an issue should be created and a PR issued for the change.

the locations gem should load the data into memory and deliver API responses from here instead of from a database.

Similarly, traject should load the data into memory for use in translation maps.

These migraiton steps will be ticketed separately; closing this issue.

bibdata.title: Refactor traject to use location config files instead of Translation Maps
Add a rake task to create a yaml file for the alma locations

comments.body: I thought the plan was to move everything into a json file.

It can be either or. The current json files have the voyager values mapped to alma. 
The future json or yaml files will be a dump of the alma location values so that we can update the location tables anytime.
Okay as long as this isn't in addition to the json files we were talking about! üëçüèª

> Okay as long as this isn't in addition to the json files we were talking about! üëçüèª

Are you talking about the json files with the mapped voyager alma values https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/pull/1213/files or about the future files we want to use to update the locations?

My understanding is that the mapped voyager-alma value files are temporary, and at the end of the day we will have 1 set of config files representing everything that it currently stored in the locations database. Whether it's json or yaml I'm not sure I have an opinion about.
Yes correct.
So it seems like this rake task will also be temporary, right?

Yes the rake task I thought about it to be temporary. My first thought was ok we update the locations with the correct flags now we need to dump them so that we can upload them locally and do our work until we move on to the next location tickets.
This was also the main reason I tried https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/pull/1235

bibdata.title: Add error handling around Alma's concurrent API threshold limit
Alma HTTP 429 (PER_SECOND_THRESHOLD)
Upload SCSB Records to S3
Return bound-with host items from /bibliographic/:mms_id/holding/:holding_id/availability
Inventory clients using bibdata endpoints and ensure they handle 429 appropriately
Replace fixtures in traject config spec
[Do not merge] Alma Migration
Prototype for endpoint to provide availability for mfhd
Bib availability end point
Investigate skipped holdings test in traject config spec
Investigate  skipped elf-related tests in traject config spec
Fix improperly formatted 008 fields in Alma fixtures
Don't add elf locations to locations db when populating database
Clean up dump files on sftp server

comments.body: Normally the way this would get handled is a cron job on `lib-sftp` that just does `find /alma/* -mtime +30 -exec rm {} \;`, but it doesn't look like lib-sftp is handled by ansible. @kayiwa should we add an ansible role that only does that somehow? Or maybe we should just add this to that box?
We should enter the cron manually and document it in pul-the-hard-way. Put the cron job on the user who owns the files.

bibdata.title: 008 fields from the bibdata bibliographic endpoint are improperly formatted

comments.body: This is a browser display problem. If you `wget` those URLs the 008 fields are right.

The issue in staff view seems to be a display issue, the correct value is shown if you view-source 

![Screen Shot 2021-04-14 at 1 42 43 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/568286/114755704-f4b94500-9d27-11eb-89d8-8caf4f3c19a5.png)

bibdata.title: Remove elf locations from access.rb

comments.body: The code that generates the database tables needs to filter these out, since we are not going to have them removed from the Online library in Alma any time soon.  https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1245

bibdata.title: Don't add zobsolete library and locations when we pull location values from alma
Build, provision, deploy production alma infrastructure
Post incremental ReCAP dump files to S3

comments.body: I don't know if the publishing profile can handle SubmitCollection for bound-withs. Also, the entire call number (852 h and i) needs to be in the 852$h. So I think there's going to have to be additional work done on the records before submitting them to SCSB.

bibdata.title: Add LocationToFileService to create holding and delivery json files
Run a full index for initial QA

comments.body: @christinach every time I deploy I have to copy that one template map before I can run the index. I'm not sure why or what we can do to keep it so we don't need to do this. Do you have a sense of what will take care of that for us, or do we need a new issue here?
we have an issue yes. I was planning to do this after the flags. https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1168 also https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1169
üëçüèª thanks!
The full index clocked in at 21:10:06 elapsed.
this is done and swapped in.

bibdata.title: Need 876 subfield l to have a value of 'RECAP' for SCSB exports

comments.body: @mzelesky once we're on Alma, can the publishing job be configured to add this? We've implemented the code that just pushes those dump files straight to s3.
This value may be optional
There is also the need to retrieve the bib records for any 774 field on the record before sending the file to SCSB.

bibdata.title: Fix 008 field formatting in Alma fixtures
Barcode endpoint and SubmitCollection job need the same formatting for SCSB records; bound-withs need to be handled in both places

comments.body: How many bound-withs are there? We solve this in the barcode controller with a query, which isn't a big deal because it's one resource, if we have to do this for every resource it gets prohibitively expensive on API calls (if there's a lot.)
There are roughly 15,000. So it won't be too frequent that any are included at all.
Will we have to worry about the first submitCollection needing to do 15k of them?
Yes, we will.
I'm going to start work on this, but I don't expect I'll finish it. Hopefully I'll be able to provide all the necessary research.

cicognara-catalogo.title: Metadata for Volumes Within Multi-Volume Works?

comments.body: @smallfind Yes, I think that looks great. I think when we bulk-ingested many of these items, we put the Bib ID in the parent and each child, and that's really not the best way to do it. So I think updating them as you describe makes them much more readable.

My big concern was if the child got detached without any obvious link to the parent in its own record. I'm a little worried that I'll need to go back and check old work, as I tried to hash this one out.
(Oh, and THANKS!)

dpul.title: Delete DPUL staging data and link dpul staging to figgy prod
Eliminate case sensitivity in hyper-linked search functionality (Keywords, for example)

comments.body: @kelea99 the keywords are now being forced to lowercase on import. I reindexed the collection in question. Could you let me know if this resolves the issue?

Testing now.  tested capitalized terms in search bar and it works, but throws back different results. I would assume this is due to other case sensitive metadata bits we haven't addressed. What I will say is the standardization of the keywords by forcing all lowercase works, and works well. So the request for Keywords has been fulfilled. I have sent to Ellen to test and will confirm with her today as well, @hackartisan , and update here if we can close the ticket.
Looks great, @hackartisan! Approved by Stakeholder, too. Closing ticket

dpul.title: Diacritics display issues reported  for SAE items in transliterated SInhala

comments.body: @hackartisan this ticket should be addressed only after upgrade to Spotlight 3.0, along with all the other languages we support to make sure we don't break anything we've fixed before. see @tpendragon above
updated Ellen, to ensure she knows as well

dspace-development.title: Symplectic Element deposits are failing for the production environment

comments.body:
The production environment for the OAR appears to no longer be resolving the `rt4ds` DSpace module, as the following error is logged for deposits:

```
Exception type: System.Web.Http.HttpResponseException
Message: Processing of the HTTP request resulted in an exception. Please see the HTTP response returned by the 'Response' property of this exception for details.
Stack trace:
at Symplectic.Foundation.Http.SympHttpClient+<SendAsync>d__16.MoveNext() in libraries\Symplectic.Foundation\Http\SympHttpClient.cs:line 364, char 6
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task)
at Symplectic.Foundation.Http.SympHttpClient+<GetBufferedResponseAsync>d__13.MoveNext() in libraries\Symplectic.Foundation\Http\SympHttpClient.cs:line 266, char 10
at Symplectic.Foundation.Concurrency.AggregateExceptionHandling.RethrowFirstInnerNonAggregateExeption(AggregateException) in libraries\Symplectic.Foundation\Concurrency\AggregateExceptionHandling.cs:line 25, char 4
at Symplectic.Foundation.Concurrency.AggregateExceptionHandling.UnwrapResultingAggregateExceptions<TResult>(Func<TResult>) in libraries\Symplectic.Foundation\Concurrency\AggregateExceptionHandling.cs:line 40, char 5
at Symplectic.Foundation.Http.SympHttpClient.GetBufferedResponse(HttpRequestMessage, Nullable<TimeSpan>) in libraries\Symplectic.Foundation\Http\SympHttpClient.cs:line 244, char 4
at Symplectic.Elements.Repository.Client.Rt1RepositoryClient.UploadFile(ApiRepositoryPublication, Rt1RepositoryFileType, MonitoringStreamCopier, String, String, String, Int64) in elements\Repository.Client\Rt1RepositoryClient.cs:line 519, char 5

HttpResponseException-specific information:
	Request Method: POST
	Request URL: https://oar.princeton.edu/rt4ds/repository
	Response Status Code: 404
	Response Reason Phrase: Not Found
```

Searching for a substantial chunk of the title (e.g., `‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡•Ä : ‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§Ç‡§™‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡•Ä ‡§â‡§™‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§æ ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§ì‡§Ç`) works, so it may be that the URL or headers being generated are too long when URL-escaping happens.

locations.title: Roll this gem back into bibdata

openpublishing.title: Question: How big will the uploads to the service be?

comments.body: After checking with the stakeholder, generally individual uploads will be small (individual PDFS), usually lower than 1GB.  Over time, there may be a need for embedded associated media files, but these could and probably should be uploaded to a media streaming platform such as Media Central, and not OJS.

openpublishing.title: Question: Do we want to enable restful URLS?

comments.body: I don't believe this is a need for our end users.

comments.body: These won't index now that elfs are not in the locations table.
